channel.title: Welcome! on McGeehin History
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome! on McGeehin History

item.title: Hi there!
item.description: Welcome to the McGeehin history site. We will be populating a number of articles over the coming months, covering a range of family history topics!

item.title: ‘Mac’ McGeehin in WWII
item.description: ‘Mac’ McGeehin in WWII Royal Army Medical Corps Cyril McGeehin was born at 166 Exeter Street Bradford on October 22nd 1913. Known in the family as ‘Mac’ he married Dorothy Osbourn (‘Bobbie’) at St John’s Church, Moor Allerton, Leeds on 2nd July 1942, after enlisting and presumably in anticipation of service abroad. She was 23 and without rank or profession, he was 28 and a pharmacist (though also qualified as an optician).
